page.title: 06QUEENDOWN WARREN
page.content: Queendown Warren is a nature reserve near Hartlip. It is privately owned and administered by The Kent Trust for Nature Conservation. It is signposted from Hartlip, Bredhurst, Stockbury and Yelsted. The Warren is in 3 sections;Main and West Banks which are grassland and Potters Wood.The main bank only is open to the public,there are two foot- paths.The name 'Warren' comes from the rabbits that live on the banks.The Saxons used them for meat and fur.The rabbits and sheep gnaw the new trees. This preserves the open grassland. Badgers,foxes,voles,cuckoos,rare flowers, woodpeckers and spectacular trees are found;it is famous for many kinds of orchid. It is popular for picnics,jogging and tree climbing.When it snows it is also popular for sledging.
